channel.title: JDK Error
channel.description: well idk what to do. im sorta new to creating private servers. i made a new shop and when i went to compile it it said You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. so i downloaded the JDK file JDK-6u3. now when i compile it it still says i havent got JDK. this is very frustrating since im a noob at this :( can somebody please help?

item.title: JDK Error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rboymike sk8rboymike
item.description:
@sk8rboymike wrote:

alright well i erased my whole compiler n put in that.
and i think it worked!!!

it says:

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit[br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2007, 09:44:56 PM[/size][hr]Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: JDK Error
item.dc:creator: @weaving8 weaving8
item.description:
@weaving8 wrote:

skater but the code in a code box and use this for ur compiler


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
::							::
::	This Compiler is under no licenses and may	::
::	be distributed freely.				::
::							::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

item.description:
@sk8rboymike wrote:

well now it says
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Press any key to continue . . .
THEN ->

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Press any key to continue . . .
Please choose an option below to do that function.
Keep posted on the Moparscape Tutorials section for
any updates that I post.

c - Compile your server.
r - To Run your server.
e - To exit out of the program.
jar - It will create your server into an executable Jar archive.
color - Change the Text and Backround colors of this compiler.
reset - Resets your Compiler Logs.

Option:
then when i compile again…
You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 and 6.0 updates.
Go to Mod Taharok’s tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section
for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK Update.
Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: JDK Error
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

The first guy had it right.

Create a new text file with:

@echo off color 0c title your compilerCompiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac" *.java pause
in it, and click Save As.

When the dialog pops up, go to the bottom, and change it from “text Documents” to “All Files”, and in the name, name it “compiler.bat”.

Click save, exit out and run it.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK Error
item.dc:creator: @playermanny2 playermanny2
item.description:
@playermanny2 wrote:

control panel then Open Network & Internet Connections. Right click on the connection you’re using to connect to the internet and click properties. Open the Advanced tab and click on firewall settings. Open the Exceptions tab and at the bottom you should see a button “Add Port”.
Click on it, and add your server name or whatever you want it to be at the Name field.
At the Port number fill in 43594.
And make sure the TCP box has been checked.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK Error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rboymike sk8rboymike
item.description:
@sk8rboymike wrote:

ohh i see what u mean.
do i deleate the whole first part and replace it with that?
this is it:

@echo off
if exist “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java” set programfiles=C:\Program Files (x86)
set pr=%programfiles%\Java
:co1
set b=0
set t=7
goto co2
:co2
color %b%%t%
:menu
cls
